revised_title: The Impact of Magnetic Fields on the Electrical Conductivity of Flames
tldr: This study investigates the effect of a magnetic field on the electrical conductivity of a flame. The research found that the resistance of the flame changes when a magnetic field is applied, and the induced electric force in the flame is much larger than expected. The results suggest that the effect of the magnetic field on the resistance of the flame can be represented as the sum of two terms, one proportional to the square of the field and the other proportional to the field.
